channel.title: CyberNetSec - Patch Management
channel.description: Latest patch management threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Wireshark Vulnerabilities Create Denial-of-Service Risk for Security Teams
item.description:
France's national cybersecurity agency, CERT-FR, has issued a security advisory for two critical vulnerabilities in Wireshark, the world's most popular network protocol analyzer. The flaws, identified as CVE-2025-13945 and CVE-2025-13946, can be exploited by a remote attacker to cause a denial-of-se...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Security Operations

Read Full Article →

item.title: Cloudflare Outage Hits 28% of Global Traffic After Faulty React2Shell Patch
item.description:
Cloudflare, a leading internet infrastructure provider, experienced a 25-minute global outage on December 5, 2025, that impacted approximately 28% of its HTTP traffic and made numerous popular websites inaccessible. The company quickly confirmed the disruption was not a cyberattack but was self-infl...

Severity: High

Categories: Security Operations, Cyberattack, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Critical 7-Zip RCE Vulnerability Now Under Active Exploitation
item.description:
A critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in the popular 7-Zip file archiver, tracked as CVE-2025-11001, is now being actively exploited in the wild. The path traversal flaw, which affects versions prior to 25.0.0, can be triggered when a user extracts a specially crafted malicious archiv...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: AWS Boosts Cloud Defense with New AI-Powered Security Tools at re:Invent 2025
item.description:
At its re:Invent 2025 conference, Amazon Web Services (AWS) unveiled several major additions to its security portfolio, heavily infused with artificial intelligence. Key announcements on December 3, 2025, included the preview of AWS Security Agent, a context-aware tool for proactive application secu...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Cloud Security, Security Operations, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Urgent Android Update: Google Patches 107 Flaws, Two Zero-Days Under Active Attack
item.description:
Google has issued its December 2025 Android security bulletin, patching a total of 107 vulnerabilities. The update is critical, as it addresses two high-severity zero-days, CVE-2025-48633 (Information Disclosure) and CVE-2025-48572 (Elevation of Privilege), which are under limited, targeted exploita...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Mitsubishi ICS Software Flaw Exposes Credentials in Plaintext
item.description:
On November 27, 2025, Mitsubishi Electric issued a security advisory for CVE-2025-3784, an information disclosure vulnerability in its GX Works2 industrial control system (ICS) software. The flaw, which affects all versions of the software, involves the storage of credential information in plaintext...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Vulnerability, Industrial Control Systems, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Critical 10.0 CVSS Flaw in Azure Bastion Allows Full Cloud Takeover
item.description:
Microsoft has patched a critical authentication bypass vulnerability, CVE-2025-49752, in its Azure Bastion service. The flaw, which scores a perfect 10.0 on the CVSS scale, could allow a remote, unauthenticated attacker to gain administrative control over all virtual machines connected via a vulnera...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cloud Security, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA Warns of Critical Flaws in Industrial Control Systems, Including CVSS 10.0 Bug
item.description:
On November 25, 2025, CISA issued seven new advisories for vulnerabilities in Industrial Control Systems (ICS) from multiple vendors, including Rockwell Automation, Opto 22, and Zenitel. The flaws affect equipment used globally in critical manufacturing and communications sectors. The most severe vu...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Vulnerability, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: NVIDIA AI Toolkit and WordPress Plugins Hit with High-Severity Flaws
item.description:
On November 25, 2025, several new software vulnerabilities were disclosed, including a high-severity Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) flaw in NVIDIA's NeMo Agent Toolkit (CVE-2025-33203) used for AI development. This flaw could lead to information disclosure and denial of service. Concurrently, vu...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: URGENT: CISA Orders 7-Day Patch for Actively Exploited FortiWeb Zero-Day
item.description:
Fortinet has disclosed a critical OS command injection zero-day vulnerability, CVE-2025-58034, in its FortiWeb Web Application Firewall (WAF) that is being actively exploited in the wild. The flaw allows an authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the underlying system. In response to...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →
